titleStmt.title: [Resolution] 1819 Jan. 8 United States Senate : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: United States Senate

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Resolution] 1819 Jan. 8 United States Senate
bibl.author: United States Senate
bibl.note: This document is a resolution dated January 8, 1819 by the United States Senate requesting that the President initiate negotiations with the Chicasaw Indians for the cession of a four mile tract of land to the state of Tennessee.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
Mr Mister . Williams of Tennessee submitted the following resolution, Resolved the President of the United States be requested to institute a negotiation with the Chicasaw tribe of Indians for the cession of a tract of land four miles square including a salt spring reserved to said tribe by th- 4th article of a treaty concluded on the 19th day of oct October . 1818 said cession when made shall be for the benefit of the state of Tennessee on said state paying the expense of holding said treaty__
Resolution of the Senate of the
U United . States
